function.name: google_search
function.description: A Google search result API. When you need a short and clear answer to a specific question, you can use it. The input should be a search query.

k.description: Select first k results in the search results as response.

function.name: get_current_info
function.description: Get the current time, date, day, month and year, or timestamp based on the format specified.

timezone.description: Optional IANA timezone identifier (e.g., "America/New_York"). Defaults to the configured timezone or UTC.

function.name: ats_scoring_service
function.description: Score a resume against a job description to surface ATS compatibility, matched strengths, and optimization opportunities.

resume_text.description: Full resume text that should be evaluated for ATS compatibility.

job_description.description: Target job description or posting details to align the resume against.

job_title.description: Optional job title to improve context-specific scoring.

focus_skills.description: Optional list of priority skills or keywords to emphasize during scoring.

experience_level.description: Optional experience level (e.g., entry, mid, senior) to tune the scoring rubric.

locale.description: Optional locale or region to account for geographic hiring nuances.

function.name: analytics_dashboard
function.description: Refresh an analytics dashboard with numeric metrics, cohort breakdowns, and contextual metadata.

dashboard_id.description: Identifier for the analytics dashboard being updated.

summary.description: High level narrative summarising the changes contained in the snapshot.

metrics.description: Numeric metrics to include in the refreshed dashboard snapshot.

segments.description: Optional cohort or segment breakdowns that accompany the metrics.

tags.description: Optional tags or labels used for filtering the analytics snapshot.

metadata.description: Optional structured metadata that provides additional context.

function.name: content_repository
function.description: Store or refresh reusable content blocks including metadata, tags, and attachments.

content_id.description: Unique identifier for the content entry.

title.description: Title used to describe the content block.

body.description: Primary body content, typically plain text or Markdown.

tags.description: Optional tags applied for classification or search.

attachments.description: Optional attachment references associated with the content.

metadata.description: Optional structured metadata stored alongside the content.
